weather.description: Mild but wet and windy, with frequent Atlantic rain showers making it the least favorable month for outdoor activities.
Similar to January with persistent rain and overcast skies, though temperatures remain mild by European standards.
Spring begins slowly with continued rainfall and changeable conditions, though days gradually lengthen.
Rain becomes less frequent and greenery peaks, making it a pleasant time for hiking and sightseeing between showers.
Noticeably warmer and drier with more sunshine, ideal for exploring the island's volcanic landscapes and lakes.
Early summer brings warm, mostly sunny days with low rainfall, making it one of the better months to visit.
The warmest and driest month, with long sunny days perfect for whale watching, swimming, and outdoor exploration.
Hot and sunny with calm seas, peak tourist season and ideal beach and water activity conditions.
Warm and still largely dry, with slightly fewer crowds than August and excellent conditions for hiking and diving.
Autumn brings increasing cloud cover and occasional rain, though temperatures remain comfortable for sightseeing.
Noticeably wetter and windier as Atlantic storms become more common, though the island stays lush and green.
Cool, wet, and often stormy, with short days and frequent rain, though the festive atmosphere in the city offers some appeal.
